title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Orlando Magic defeated the Boston Celtics 123-110, marking the Celtics' first loss in the NBA Cup.
Jaylen Brown scored 32 points on 15-for-28 shooting but struggled from long range, going 1-for-6 on three-pointers.
The Celtics struggled defensively, allowing 38 first-quarter points and 39 in the fourth, with Franz Wagner scoring 27 for the Magic.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph recommended for public reprimand for creating appearance of impropriety despite lack of misconduct evidence.
Hearing officer Denis J. McInerney found insufficient evidence against Joseph regarding 2018 ICE escape plan involvement.
Joseph and a court officer were federally charged in 2019, charges dropped in 2022 after agreeing to a state probe.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox Manager Alex Cora expresses optimism for the team's future despite postseason elimination by Yankees.
Trevor Story remains with Boston, while Alex Bregman opts out; Lucas Giolito not given qualifying offer.
Boston finished 89-73, third in AL East, but Cora believes roster's postseason experience is valuable.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 75-100 foot blade detached from a 300-foot wind turbine in Plymouth, landing in a nearby cranberry bog.
The incident occurred near 810 Head of the Bay Road; no injuries were reported, and public safety is assured.
The turbine automatically shut down, and cleanup efforts are underway as the investigation continues.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' is a new Marvel film streaming on Disney+, featuring a fresh take on the superhero team.
'Frankenstein', a unique adaptation by Guillermo del Toro, is now available for streaming on Netflix.
'Squid Game: The Challenge' Season 2 continues on Netflix, featuring 456 contestants competing for a $4 million prize.

title: Stefon Diggs reveals what he’s trying to improve about himself after 11 years in the NFL
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Stefon Diggs is focusing on improving his attitude, aiming for perfection while managing competitive drive in his 11th NFL season.
Diggs leads the Patriots with 508 receiving yards, 56.4 yards per game, and 45 receptions in the current season.
Offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels and WR coach Todd Downing have fostered a supportive environment contributing to the Patriots' offensive success.

title: Commuter train plows through car on tracks in Acton
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: An MBTA commuter train collided with an empty car on the tracks in Acton, pushing it about 300 feet.
The car's driver exited before the crash, which occurred around 5:30 p.m. near 117 Central St.
Fitchburg line service was delayed, and the driver will receive a citation for bypassing closed crossing gates.

title: What to know about possible Red Sox free agent target Munetaka Murakami after posting
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Munetaka Murakami, a top NPB hitter, was posted by Tokyo Yakult Swallows, offering MLB teams until Dec. 22 to sign him.
Murakami's power is notable, with 142 home runs from 2022-2025, but his high strikeout rates pose a concern in MLB.
Speculation links the Red Sox, Giants, Dodgers, Yankees, Mets, Phillies, and Mariners as potential suitors for Murakami.

title: Airlines are waiving fees, offering refunds due to reduced flight schedules
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Airlines are waiving fees and offering refunds after the FAA cut flights by 10% at 40 airports, including Logan.
JetBlue, Southwest, and United Airlines are offering rebooking options and refunds to travelers with canceled or affected flights.
American Airlines and Delta are waiving change fees and providing refunds for tickets affected by the reduced flight schedules.

title: After Cape Cod crash, readers say Mass. should tighten e-bike regulations
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: A Cape Cod crash involving a 69-year-old woman reignited the debate over Massachusetts' e-bike regulations.
A poll showed 78% of Boston.com readers support stricter e-bike rules while 20% oppose further regulation.
Massachusetts currently does not regulate Class 3 e-bikes, which can exceed 20 MPH, unlike Class 1 and 2 e-bikes.
